column5: Hey everyone, just wondering if anyone has any info regarding fishing conditions on Pigeon Lake, near Big Island (north end)?  Haven't fished the lake in 20 years, remember catching a few pickerel. Imagine there are crappie and perch too?  How's the ice right now?
Just panfish open in the winter on Pigeon.
Thanks for the reminder, just checked the regs. That changes everything....Gotta chase crappie I guess, many perch in there?
Perch numbers are low. Mostly bluegills and Rockies. Some guys can find crappies.
All of the kawarthas are pan fish only. And pike if the lake has it.
Nice weekend coming up I might head up for some blue's. Worried the ice might not be good though

Nice weekend coming up I might head up for some blue's. Worried the ice might not be good though  I havent been to Pigeon so I cant confirm its thickness but I have been to Simcoe which is a much larger body of water and Ive been out to 30FOW and its over 12" thick everywhere Ive been.
+6 Saturday and Sunday, gonna be loads of slush I guess....
